Issues.Title: Update eslint: 8.19.0 ‚Üí 8.20.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è eslint (8.19.0 ‚Üí 8.20.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/eslint/eslint) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

8.20.0

Features

Bug Fixes

  • 30be0ed fix: no-warning-comments rule escapes special RegEx characters in terms (#16090) (Lachlan Hunt)
  • bfe5e88 fix: ignore spacing before ] and } in comma-spacing (#16113) (Milos Djermanovic)

Documentation

  • 845c4f4 docs: Add website team details (#16115) (Nicholas C. Zakas)
  • 5a0dfdb docs: Link to blog post in no-constant-binary-expression (#16112) (Jordan Eldredge)
  • bc692a9 docs: remove install command (#16084) (Strek)

  • ba19e3f docs: enhance 404 page UI (#16097) (Amaresh S M)
  • a75d3b4 docs: remove unused meta.docs.category field in working-with-rules page (#16109) (Brandon Scott)
  • cdc0206 docs: add formatters page edit link (#16094) (Amaresh S M)
  • 4d1ed22 docs: preselect default theme (#16098) (Strek)
  • 4b79612 docs: add missing correct/incorrect containers (#16087) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 09f6acb docs: fix UI bug on rules index and details pages (#16082) (Deepshika S)
  • f5db264 docs: remove remaining duplicate rule descriptions (#16093) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 32a6b2a docs: Add scroll behaviour smooth (#16056) (Amaresh S M)

Chores

  • bbf8df4 chore: Mark autogenerated release blog post as draft (#16130) (Nicholas C. Zakas)
  • eee4306 chore: update internal lint dependencies (#16088) (Bryan Mishkin)
  • 9615a42 chore: update formatter examples template to avoid markdown lint error (#16085) (Milos Djermanovic)
  • 62541ed chore: fix markdown linting error (#16083) (ÂîØÁÑ∂)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update eslint: 8.19.0 ‚Üí 8.20.0 (minor)" (#8996)

Issues.Title: Extended rem value not applied without space
Issues.Body:
Next.js project using version 12.1.6 and tailwindcss version ^3.0.24.

I have extended a few properties in tailwind.config.js, when extending the minHeight like so: 

```
minHeight: {
  20: '5 rem',
  'product-preview': '85 rem',
},
```

The rem is applied, but it is **not** applied when setting it like this (as the documentation suggests):
```
minHeight: {
  20: '5rem',
  'product-preview': '85rem',
},
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Extended rem value not applied without space" (#8993)

Issues.Title: dangerouslySetInnerHTML not working with Taillwind and React.js
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/7756
Originally posted by **AayushBiswas** March 5, 2022 I am creating an app and fetching tailwind codes from an localhost file the file Code section looks like this ``` ``` It's json. Slashes are not counted. but on dangerouslySetInnerHTML it doesn't work
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dangerouslySetInnerHTML not working with Taillwind and React.js" (#8988)

Issues.Title: Remove class prefix in arbitrary variant that is used multiple times
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in #8932

Fixes the issue when a class prefix is configured and an arbitrary variant with a class name is used within the variant, the class within the variant would have the class prefix when the same arbitrary variant is used more than once.

Extension of PR #8773.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove class prefix in arbitrary variant that is used multiple times" (#8992)

Issues.Title: Custom color opacity in theme function
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Custom color opacity in theme function" (#8991)

Issues.Title: Exclude prettier rule in ESLint
Issues.Body: This PR intend to exclude prettier rule in ESLint. Mainly to prevent to display squiggly lines about `prettier/prettier` in editor, **red lines in `prettier/prettier` in vscode** **This PR change** - remove about `eslint-plugin-prettier` settings in `eslintrc.json`.- - append prettier command in `style` script in `package.json` **references** https://prettier.io/docs/en/integrating-with-linters.html#notes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Exclude prettier rule in ESLint" (#8990)

Issues.Title: space-x should update variable to just work in rtl languages
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind v3.1.2



**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v14.17.3



**What browser are you using?**

Mobile first and only modern browsers



**What operating system are you using?**

macOS



**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/MWbXRd47S6



**Describe your issue**

in rtl --tw-space-x-reverse: 0; should be set to 1

Currently, in rtl the margin is to the left instead of switching to the right via the variable noted above.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "space-x should update variable to just work in rtl languages" (#8985)

Issues.Title: Gradient stop breaks with mediaquery
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

@astrojs/tailwind: ^0.2.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Astro

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

16.5.1

**What browser are you using?**

N/A, tried Chrome and Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

[**Reproduction URL**](https://play.tailwindcss.com/V8VenQzI76)

**Describe your issue**

Gradient breaks when using media queries in a specific way.

```
<div class="bg-gradient-to-b from-black/0 via-black sm:via-black/50 to-black absolute inset-0" />
```

Works fine on smalles screens, but when bigger it breaks. Goes black/0 > black-50 > black/0, instead of Goes black/0 > black-50 > black/100.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Gradient stop breaks with mediaquery" (#8978)

Issues.Title: Tailwind doesnt allow forcing !important with selector in place
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

vite 3.0.3

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

16.14.10

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox 101/Chromium 103

**What operating system are you using?**

Fedora 36

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/2OCzJLtC9x

**Describe your issue**

Tailwind allows 2 modes for important application:
Mode 1 lets me go with !important on all styles
Mode 2 with just a selector.

However many common frameworks exist that share styles with tailwind and override them with !important if i only use a selector.
For these Tailwind would need to allow me to not only use the selector but also mark the generated styles as !important by default.

So important: '#selector', forceimportant: true
Or something similar.

Else i'd be forced to override each style bootstrap happens to share on an existing page with !p-2 or !px-2 - and hoping bootstrap doesnt add any more on updates.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind doesnt allow forcing !important with selector in place" (#8979)

Issues.Title: Preflight improvement on fieldset
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** For example: v3.1.6 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Angular 13 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.0.0 **What browser are you using?** Firefox **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Describe your issue** Current preflight reset for fieldset is below. The problem with fieldset is truncate does not work within fieldset. Due to the minimum width default for fieldset. ```CSS fieldset { margin: 0; padding: 0; } ``` Suggest change. ```CSS fieldset { min-width: 0; margin: 0; padding: 0; } ``` Today, I have spent more than an hour to try to figure out what's going on with truncate. To avoid others fall into this trap, it would be good to provide as default. Without `min-width:0` following truncate won't work. ```HTML
Aliquet nec orci mattis amet quisque ullamcorper neque, nibh sem. At arcu, sit dui mi, nibh dui, diam eget aliquam. Quisque id at vitae feugiat egestas ac. Diam nulla orci at in viverra scelerisque eget. Eleifend egestas fringilla sapien.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Preflight improvement on fieldset" (#8972)

Issues.Title: A11y issue : semantics on Lists being removed with Safari as list-style: none is a default.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
React v18.2.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v16.14.2

**What browser are you using?**
Safari v15.5

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS Monterey v12.4

**Reproduction URL**
Create a basic React app with CRA for instance, add a list `<ul>` with a few elements. Launch VoiceOver and go through the page content to find the list. VoiceOver does not announce any list and just reads each `<li>` element text. 

**Describe your issue**
Because `list-style: none` is applied as default by Tailwind, semantics are removed as aknowledged by different people working on accessibility (check this post : https://www.scottohara.me/blog/2019/01/12/lists-and-safari.html).
I understand why native styles are removed as default (they are usually reset) and this is more a Safari issue. Yet, as tailwind reaches almost 3M downloads per week (https://www.npmjs.com/package/tailwindcss), this behaviour may have a significant impact. Of course, it's up to Safari developers to fix this on their side if they're willing to. Meanwhile, an alternative to default styles for lists should be provided, or at least something in the docs to notify tailwind users about this issue. 

One hack to restore semantics when `list-style: none` is applied : https://gerardkcohen.me/writing/2017/voiceover-list-style-type.html
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A11y issue : semantics on Lists being removed with Safari as list-style: none is a default." (#8975)

Issues.Title: Incorrect work of url() in css file when using vite.js
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "3.1.6"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"vite": "3.0.3"

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.16.0

**What browser are you using?**

Any

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows (WSL2)

**Reproduction URL**
https://codesandbox.io/s/vite-tailwind-bug-jm7w9h

**Describe your issue**

If vite.config.js entry point is a style file, for example, for a classic backend, then the url() in css files are not processed.
But if I comment out the tilewindcss plugin in the postcss.config.js file, then everything works fine.

Result with tailwindcss: (not processed)
```
.test{background-image:url(img.svg)}
```
Result without tailwindcss: (processed)
```
.test{background-image:url(/img-8dac5379.svg)}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect work of url() in css file when using vite.js" (#8966)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don't rewrite source maps for `@layer` rules" (#8971)

Issues.Title: Update jest: 28.1.2 ‚Üí 28.1.3 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è jest (28.1.2 ‚Üí 28.1.3) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/facebook/jest) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

28.1.3

Features

Fixes

  • [jest-changed-files] Fix a lock-up after repeated invocations (#12757)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)

  • [jest-snapshot] Fix indentation of awaited inline snapshots (#12986)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [*] Replace internal usage of pretty-format/ConvertAnsi with jest-serializer-ansi-escapes (#12935, #13004)
  • [docs] Update spyOn docs (#13000)

New Contributors

  • @joshkel made their first contribution in #12960
  • @enrilzhou made their first contribution in #12973
  • @milahu made their first contribution in #12983
  • @MiguelYax made their first contribution in #13000
  • @kaffarell made their first contribution in #13015
  • @TheKhanj made their first contribution in #12988
  • @Fdawgs made their first contribution in #13019

Full Changelog: v28.1.2...v28.1.3

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 25 commits:

  • v28.1.3
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update docusaurus (#13021)
  • refactor(jest-mock): simplify `PropertyLikeKeys` utility type (#13020)
  • fix: missing spaces in string concats (#13019)
  • chore: bump `typescript` and related dependencies (#13017)
  • Update JestCommunity.md (#12988)
  • chore: update react-native example (#13016)
  • chore: fixed changelog.md typo (#13015)
  • chore: update babel
  • chore: update lint dependencies (#13014)
  • Update spyOn docs (#13000)
  • Refine babel-plugin-jest-hoist typings (#13011)
  • fix(jest-mock): add index signature support for `spyOn` types (#13013)
  • fix(scripts): also check for package.json (#12983)
  • chore: bump `jest-serialiser-ansi-escapes` (#13004)
  • chore: replace `pretty-format/ConvertAnsi` with `jest-serializer-ansi-escapes` (#12935)
  • docs: minor grammar correction from "as document" to "as documented" (#12995)
  • Correct `await`-ed inline snapshot indentation (#12986)
  • feat(jest-leak-detector): use FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external dependency (#12973)
  • chore: bump `jest-runner-tsd` (#12981)
  • fix: Switch from throat to p-limit (#12960)
  • feat: upgrade TypeBox (#12979)
  • fix(expect-utils): Fix equalityof ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • chore: update lockfile after release

Issues.Title: Buttons have cursor: pointer by default, but should not for accessibility reasons
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vite 3.0.0 (rollup)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v16.13.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-tailwind-qds1vc?file=index.js

**Describe your issue**

While it's common to give `<button>`s `cursor: pointer;`, this is an anti-pattern. The [CSS spec](https://drafts.csswg.org/css-ui-3/#valdef-cursor-pointer) establishes that `cursor: pointer` indicates an element is a link.

[This article](https://medium.com/simple-human/buttons-shouldnt-have-a-hand-cursor-b11e99ca374b) has some additional justification for this. I understand many users will want to override this behavior back to the common misuse of `cursor: pointer;`, but Tailwind should be correct by default.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Buttons have cursor: pointer by default, but should not for accessibility reasons" (#8961)

Issues.Title: Don't use `cursor: pointer` for buttons by default
Issues.Body:
This is a pretty common expectation but as outlined in in #8961 isn't really right. We considered this a long time ago but it felt too against the grain at the time. These days though very UI-forward applications like [Linear](https://linear.app/) are using the default cursor for buttons and I think this trend will continue as more people become aware that `cursor: pointer` is meant for links.

Let's update our defaults here to help nudge people in this direction and make it more common. If people want to change this in their own apps, it's just a line or two of CSS to add to their projects.

Closed #8961.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Don't use `cursor: pointer` for buttons by default" (#8962)

Issues.Title: React CSS modules can't use `dark:` variants
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

`^3.1.6`

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

`create react app 5.0.1, etc.`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`v16.15.0`

**What browser are you using?**

`Chrome, Brave`

**What operating system are you using?**

`macOS`

**Reproduction URL**
https://charming-mooncake-2fc871.netlify.app/
https://github.com/murderteeth/react-css-modules-w-darkmode

**Describe your issue**
In my react projects dark mode variants work great when I use them from a regular style sheet. Dark mode variants _do not work_ when I use them from css modules.

This is similar to https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/6388, but the resolution doesn't seem to apply to css modules, per https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/6388#issuecomment-1010106111.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89237203/181102570-5be1c21d-15f8-4176-9483-7eccbe438777.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "React CSS modules can't use `dark:` variants" (#8960)

Issues.Title: Missing declaration file for "tailwindcss/resolveConfig"
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

For example: v3.1.6

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Vite, Typescript

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v16.15.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows 10

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/joshmossas/tailwindcss-resolve-config-missing-types

**Describe your issue**

When attempting to use the [resolveConfig](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/configuration#referencing-in-java-script) helper in a typescript project you get a type error `Could not find a declaration file for module 'tailwindcss/resolveConfig'`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Missing declaration file for "tailwindcss/resolveConfig"" (#8920)

Issues.Title: Add declaration file for resolveConfig
Issues.Body:
<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->

Fix for https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/8920.

This PR adds a `resolveConfig.d.ts` file to prevent from getting the typescript error `Could not find a declaration file for module 'tailwindcss/resolveConfig'`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add declaration file for resolveConfig" (#8924)

Issues.Title: fix:change preflight button selector
Issues.Body:
- pr change `preflight.css`
- Exclude attribute selector higher than class when `<button type="button" />`

fix: https://github.com/unocss/unocss/issues/1315
[type=button] style preset in prelight.css is not very friendly in some components  libraries
due to attribute selector higher than class, reset style overrides the class style
```html
<button type="button" class="btn">
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix:change preflight button selector" (#8938)

Issues.Title: [IntelliSense] Support vscode in the browser
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8922
Originally posted by **Promhize** July 21, 2022 Extension currently doesn't work on vscode.dev and github.dev. It will be great to support these
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[IntelliSense] Support vscode in the browser" (#8923)

Issues.Title: Tailwind divide classes are not being applied
Issues.Body:
I am trying to use the `divider-y` in combination with the `divider-gray-100` to add borders between a list of links in a dropdown: The issue is that there no css being applied for it... I took this straight from code listed for one of the free components on the website. Here is my code: ```
Your Profile ...
``` Framework: Vue js - 3.2.37 Tailwind CSS: v3.1.6 Browser: Chrome OS: Linux / uBuntu 20.04.4 LTS Node js: v16.14.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tailwind divide classes are not being applied" (#8919)

Issues.Title: I can't set up a new rails project with tailwind-css
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8915
Originally posted by **deyemiobaa** July 21, 2022 Hello, I'm trying to set up a new rails project with `rails new my_app --css tailwind` && `rails new my_app --css=tailwind` but I keep getting an error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55185309/180105856-9ccf9863-e711-4f00-af84-12420a0110f1.png) This same error also exists if I try to add tailwind-CSS manually using the steps specified in the documentation ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55185309/180106000-913b8f61-3599-499e-aebb-47fe4b527e46.png) I use a Windows 10 PC
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I can't set up a new rails project with tailwind-css" (#8916)

Issues.Title: ADDING BACKGROUND IMAGE TO STATIC HOSTED PAGE
Issues.Body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/discussions/8912
Originally posted by **thrila** July 20, 2022 I added a background image in my project and it worked on the live version i then ran `npm build && npm export ` and made the site live on github when the site became live the rest of my CSS worked but my image wouldn't work the way i imported inserted the image is `background-image: url('../public/image 2.PNG'); `
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ADDING BACKGROUND IMAGE TO STATIC HOSTED PAGE" (#8913)

Issues.Title: Update jest-diff: 28.1.1 ‚Üí 28.1.3 (patch)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è jest-diff (28.1.1 ‚Üí 28.1.3) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/facebook/jest) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/jest/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

28.1.3

Features

  • [jest-leak-detector] Use native FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external C dependency (#12973)

Fixes

  • [jest-changed-files] Fix a lock-up after repeated invocations (#12757)
  • [@jest/expect-utils] Fix deep equality of ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • [jest-mock] Add index signature support for spyOn types (#13013, #13020)
  • [jest-snapshot] Fix indentation of awaited inline snapshots (#12986)

Chore & Maintenance

  • [*] Replace internal usage of pretty-format/ConvertAnsi with jest-serializer-ansi-escapes (#12935, #13004)
  • [docs] Update spyOn docs (#13000)

New Contributors

  • @joshkel made their first contribution in #12960
  • @enrilzhou made their first contribution in #12973
  • @milahu made their first contribution in #12983
  • @MiguelYax made their first contribution in #13000
  • @kaffarell made their first contribution in #13015
  • @TheKhanj made their first contribution in #12988
  • @Fdawgs made their first contribution in #13019

Full Changelog: v28.1.2...v28.1.3

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 34 commits:

  • v28.1.3
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update docusaurus (#13021)
  • refactor(jest-mock): simplify `PropertyLikeKeys` utility type (#13020)
  • fix: missing spaces in string concats (#13019)
  • chore: bump `typescript` and related dependencies (#13017)
  • Update JestCommunity.md (#12988)
  • chore: update react-native example (#13016)
  • chore: fixed changelog.md typo (#13015)
  • chore: update babel
  • chore: update lint dependencies (#13014)
  • Update spyOn docs (#13000)
  • Refine babel-plugin-jest-hoist typings (#13011)
  • fix(jest-mock): add index signature support for `spyOn` types (#13013)
  • fix(scripts): also check for package.json (#12983)
  • chore: bump `jest-serialiser-ansi-escapes` (#13004)
  • chore: replace `pretty-format/ConvertAnsi` with `jest-serializer-ansi-escapes` (#12935)
  • docs: minor grammar correction from "as document" to "as documented" (#12995)
  • Correct `await`-ed inline snapshot indentation (#12986)
  • feat(jest-leak-detector): use FinalizationRegistry when it exists to get rid of external dependency (#12973)
  • chore: bump `jest-runner-tsd` (#12981)
  • fix: Switch from throat to p-limit (#12960)
  • feat: upgrade TypeBox (#12979)
  • fix(expect-utils): Fix equalityof ImmutableJS OrderedSets (#12977)
  • chore: update lockfile after release
  • v28.1.2
  • chore: update changelog for release
  • chore: update `docusaurus` to `beta.21` (#12955)
  • chore: update `@sinonjs/fake-timers` (#12956)
  • chore: update `v8-to-istanbul` (#12954)
  • fix(jest-runtime): avoid star type import from `@jest/globals` (#12949)
  • docs: testSequencer example use destructured arguments (#12915)
  • Mention Sinon is now supported by jest-codemods in migration guide (#12898)
  • chore: update lockfile after release
